intro: Erigeron alatus, commonly known as the silverleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and its daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. It has a taproot system and is often found in disturbed soils. Erigeron alatus is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
